result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Clark Moore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Clark Moore appeared by phone.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Daniel Clark Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense reports that defendant qualifies for a DPA and requests a DPA hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Daniel Clark Moore.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Defendant has had his TAD evaluation and the parties are waiting to see if the DPA is approved.  Parties request a status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Daniel Clark Moore.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant is having a TAD evaluation and Atty. Flynn requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Daniel Clark Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held via zoom. Attorney Flynn was recently appointed and needs additional time to review discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore in court.  
Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter set for status of counsel.  Defendant does qualify for a public defender and one will be appointed.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing on defendant's competency to represent himself held.  Court examined the defendant.  Defendant decided he would like to see if he qualifies for a public defender.  Court ordered the defendant to contact the SPD office to be eformed.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore in court.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant informed the Court he would like to represent himself.  Court ordered matter adjourned for an in-person hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daniel Clark Moore in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/10/2022@2:00pm
